Hey S=F8ren,
 
How did you add your policy to the crawler? Did you just dro=
p in a JAR file
and edit the configuration manually? Unfortunately that doe=
sn't work.
Assuming you are using the BdbFrontier, you'll need to edit
org.=
archive.crawler.frontier.AbstractFrontier where you need to add your
class =
name to the String 'queueStr' on line 260 (latest HEAD). Obviously it
would=
 be better if Heritrix read this value from a configuration file, but
it do=
esn't so I'm afraid you will have to do your edit and remake Heritrix.
Perh=
aps better, you could rewrite the class to read this from file and
submit a=
 patch.
 
To explain what is going on, The string above is used to set the =
legal
values for the queue assignment policy setting. The legal values are =
both
used by the UI to populate comboboxes and by the system to verify inpu=
t.
Clearly, your class isn't passing this verification.
 
-Kris

-----Origi=
nal Message-----
From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:archive-craw=
ler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of S=F8ren Vejrup Carlsen
Sent: 23. n=F3vemb=
er 2005 13:21
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [archive-crawler=
] Problems with using our own
queue-assignment-policy


Dear all.
In our sy=
stem, which embeds Heritrix,
We have problems using our own queue-assignmen=
t-policy.

We get the following error:
Nov 22, 2005 3:23:34 PM
org.archive.=
crawler.settings.CrawlSettingsSAXHandler 
handleValueError
WARNING: Value n=
ot in legal values list
Attribute: 'frontier:queue-assignment-policy'
Value=
:     'org.archive.crawler.frontier.DomainnameQueueAssignmentPolicy'

File:=
     
'file:/home/netarkiv/TEST1/harvester_8081/4_1132669413098/order.xml',=

line: 114, column: 115

It is not clear to me, if the heritrix.properties =
is read anywhere
implicitly in our (as we don't use the Heritrix.java class=
, but
instead instantiate a CrawlController, and use this to crawl).
The He=
ritrix.java class seems to me the only class, which loads the
heritrix.prop=
erties.

  
And if it is, which heritrix.properties is supposed to be read.=

I can see two possible default locations for the heritrix.properties:
1) I=
nside the heritrix.jar
2) In the conf/ directory
